channel.title: Mixing AUXY songs with other DAWs and Software
channel.description:
I started adding phone talk, white noise, rain samples, etc. In my AUXY projects a few months ago and recently I started mixing my projects in Pro Tools to try and break away from "AUXY sound". Does anyone else do anything like this?
Here's an example. This is an extended version of my BTC#24 that I mixed in pro tools. Let me know if you think it really effected the over all feel. https://soundcloud.com/johnny-doe-896747197/bedhead

item.title: Mixing AUXY songs with other DAWs and Software
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
Um, if you mean Ableton, yeah, it has a Session view, but I use the Arrangement view because it’s much more precise.

Read full topic
item.source: Mixing AUXY songs with other DAWs and Software

item.dc:creator: JohnnyDoe
item.description:
Yeah, from what I can tell it actually works kind of similarly to AUXY in the way that I think they both use loops and scenes n stuff

item.title: Mixing AUXY songs with other DAWs and Software
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
I can relate to you with Logic. I switch completely over to Ableton because of that.
Yeah, NI’s Machine is cool. I haven’t got to use it yet, but I did some studying on it, and it’s really cool as a plugin.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.source: Mixing AUXY songs with other DAWs and Software

item.title: Mixing AUXY songs with other DAWs and Software
item.dc:creator: JohnnyDoe
item.description:
Yeah for electronic music production Pro Tools is trash lol. That’s why I only use it to mix and track. I’ve had a pretty bad experience with Logic for whatever reason. I just felt like I had to work way to hard to make things work together. I dabbled in Machine and Ableton they feel like they spit out better content easier if that makes sense.

Read full topic
item.source: Mixing AUXY songs with other DAWs and Software

item.dc:creator: SUFOS
item.description:
No, its just the ones you get when you get FL. You get vocals.

Read full topic
item.source: Mixing AUXY songs with other DAWs and Software

item.title: Mixing AUXY songs with other DAWs and Software
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
I don’t know about Ableton Live being the cause of better content, but I do know that Live has a very nice workflow that allows for creativity. Not trying to knock Pro Tools since it’s the professional standard for engineering, but in my opinion, Pro Tools is kinda stale.
I love Logic and Live, and I’ve seen great things about Bitwig. All of these DAWs have something in common:
They just look good. They’re interface is very easy to look at, with smooth lines, and nice colors.

Read full topic
item.source: Mixing AUXY songs with other DAWs and Software

item.description:

item.source: Mixing AUXY songs with other DAWs and Software

item.title: Mixing AUXY songs with other DAWs and Software
item.dc:creator: NickElle
item.description:
I usually use a DAW with Auxy. I run the audio from my iPhone (RIP my iPhone, though) to my audio interface and sync it to Ableton Live using Ableton Link.

My main sounds don’t usually come from Auxy, though. I usually use Auxy as a “fill” sound. Like, little melodies to make my tracks more complex.

Read full topic
item.source: Mixing AUXY songs with other DAWs and Software

item.title: Mixing AUXY songs with other DAWs and Software
item.dc:creator: Karlos
item.description:
I do, mostly to mix and master the sounds. I sometimes do convert some instruments into MIDI if I feel like the Auxy app isn’t offering the sound I want.

P.S: some of my tracks are story-ish driven so they don’t follow a specific arrangement.

Also your track sounds really good, and Pro tools is Amazing. I use a basic DAW - Logic Pro

https://soundcloud.com/krls-hq/karlos-gibbson-odd-one-world

Read full topic
